name: strand-datepicker
description: A single and dual (range) date/time picker component including numeric and calendar based inputs

attributes.name: useTimezone
attributes.description: When set to true, instructs the component to display a timezone dropdown. Requires configuration data for timezones (see: timezones).

attributes.name: useRange
attributes.description: When set to true, instructs the component to display a date range dropdown. Requires configuration data range presets (see: rangePresets).

attributes.name: useTime
attributes.description: When set to true, instructs the component to display inputs for time selection.

attributes.name: useCommit
attributes.description: When set to true, instructs the component to display a footer bar which contains 'save' and 'close' buttons. Requires that the user click 'save' to persist the selection for start and end dates (see: 'start' and 'end').

attributes.name: useDuration
attributes.description: Shows an estimated duration of time between selected start and end dates

attributes.name: resetOnClose
attributes.description: When set to true, instructs the component reset when closed. Dependant upon the setting for useCommit, requires that the user click 'save' or the component will be reset to default values when closed.

attributes.name: dual
attributes.description: When set to true, instructs the component to display a start and end calendar panel.

attributes.name: dateFormat
attributes.description: The moment.js format string used for date formatting. Please note that support for additional formats would require the internal input mask configuration to be edited (see: strand-input-mask).

attributes.name: timeFormat
attributes.description: The moment.js format string used for time formatting. Please note that strand-datepicker currently only supports 12 hour time.

attributes.name: timeOnlyFormat
attributes.description: Returns the moment.js 12 hour time format without meridian value.

attributes.name: rangeValue
attributes.description: Returns the currently selected range value, as defined in range presets (see: rangePresets).

attributes.name: rangePresets
attributes.description: Configuration data used to populate the range pressets dropdown. Requires an array of objects which should contain a name, start, and end property. The 'name' property sets the dropdown item's label. The 'start' and 'end' properties require JS Date objects. The supplied 'start' and 'end' dates will set the strand-datepicker's date range.

attributes.name: rangeDescription
attributes.description: The placeholder string used to populate the range preset dropdown prior to selection.

attributes.name: timezoneDescription
attributes.description: The placeholder string used to populate the timezone dropdown prior to selection.

attributes.name: timezones
attributes.description: Configuration data used to populate the timezone dropdown. Requires an array of objects which should contain a name and value property. The 'name' property sets the dropdown item's label. The 'value' property sets the strand-datepicker's timezone.

attributes.name: start
attributes.description: The selected start date. In a dual configuration, this is the selected start date. In single configuration, this will be the only date available.

attributes.name: startEnabled
attributes.description: The default value for the start enabled checkbox which appears when startEnabledLabel is specified (see: startEnabledLabel).

attributes.name: startUserEnabled
attributes.description: If true, will display a start enabled checkbox, allowing the user to control the start enabled checkbox state.

attributes.name: allowedStart
attributes.description: If set, does not allow selection of a date prior to the specified value.

attributes.name: startLabel
attributes.description: The label text for the blue header which appears in the top left section of the strand-datepicker.

attributes.name: startEnabledLabel
attributes.description: If set, instructs the component to display a start enabled checkbox. Typically used when the strand-datepicker needs to be constrained to a particular start date. This also the text which will be displayed next to the checkbox.

attributes.name: startDate
attributes.description: A string in the specified dateFormat (see: dateFormat) used to set the strand-datepicker's default start date.

attributes.name: startTime
attributes.description: A date object representing the desired default start time, used to set the time input field.

attributes.name: startTimePeriod
attributes.description: Sets the value of the meridian dropdown located next to the start time input field.

attributes.name: end
attributes.description: The selected end date. In a dual configuration, this is the selected end date. In single configuration, this will be the only date available.

attributes.name: endEnabled
attributes.description: The default value for the end enabled checkbox which appears when endEnabledLabel is specified (see: endEnabledLabel).

attributes.name: endUserEnabled
attributes.description: If true, will display a end enabled checkbox, allowing the user to control the end enabled checkbox state.

attributes.name: allowedEnd
attributes.description: If set, does not allow selection of a date after to the specified value.

attributes.name: endLabel
attributes.description: The label text for the blue header which appears in the top right section of the strand-datepicker.

attributes.name: endEnabledLabel
attributes.description: If set, instructs the component to display a end enabled checkbox. Typically used when the strand-datepicker needs to be constrained to a particular end date. This also the text which will be displayed next to the checkbox.

attributes.name: endDate
attributes.description: A string in the specified dateFormat (see: dateFormat) used to set the strand-datepicker's default end date.

attributes.name: endTime
attributes.description: A date object representing the desired default end time, used to set the time input field.

attributes.name: endTimePeriod
attributes.description: Sets the value of the meridian dropdown located next to the end time input field.

attributes.name: timezone
attributes.description: Returns a string representing the selected timezone, as specified in data configuration for timezones (see: timezones)

attributes.name: closeLabel
attributes.description: A string used for text of 'close' link in footer

attributes.name: saveLabel
attributes.description: A string used for text of 'save' button in footer

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the selected 'start' and 'end' dates either to their default values, or to the values specified in arguments.

arguments.name: start
arguments.description: A date object representing the start date (and time) to reset the picker instance to.

arguments.name: end
arguments.description: A date object representing the end date (and time) to reset the picker instance to.

methods.name: save
methods.description: Commits any pending date or date range values selected, and closes the strand-datepicker.

detail.name: start
detail.description: The start date the user has chosen.

detail.name: end
detail.description: The end date the user has chosen.
